intro: Angostura elegans, commonly known as the elegant angostura, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite and often have a glossy, dark green appearance. Angostura elegans is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
